items.text: slower ball on off stump, Mithun plays it well, spotting the variation and blocking it with all his might
items.shortText: Reifer to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: wanders down leg as he goes for the flick
works it through midwicket
items.postText: _Shanto: "AnamBMDF, Come on man! We know the limitations. Aren't those applicable more or less for all Asian countries? Still they are delivering, right? Sometimes its better to accept limitations, then try to go beyond them. They are the best guys we've got so far. "

items.text: attempts a hook, but the ball is onto him too quickly, the bouncer, climbing up past his shoulder. And it's because of that that he mis-hits it to third man
pulls it round the corner to long leg

slower ball outside off, he defends behind point and thinks about a single. But Carter is across quickly enough. Misfilds though which makes Mithun think a single is on. But Mushfiqur sends him back just in time
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: glides a short ball outside off to third man

items.preText: Aj: "Fabian Allen is actually a specialist batsman so yes their blind faith is really strange as is the decision to not back the only leg spinner in the WI in Bishoo "
items.text: gets up off his toes and glides the short ball on off stump to deep third man
defends a good length ball on off stump
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: dabs the shortish delivery to point
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full on off stump, dinks it to mid-on and runs
looks to glide the back of a length ball outside off to third man, but is beaten. Holder and Hope appeal for a caught behind, but even they don't seem convinced
items.shortText: Holder to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full on off stump, defends to point
items.shortText: Holder to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Chris: "Does Pollard not fancy giving the world cup a go? Pollard, Russell and Holder at 6, 7 and 8 would give awesome balance to the batting and bowling " --- Not his fault if he hasn't been picked
items.text: pulls the short ball from outside off down to deep midwicket
adjusts to the change in pace outside off and then chops down on top of it to get a single to third man
pulls it over long leg, uses the angle round the wicket to his advantage as he swivels on the back foot and lifts it over the hospitality section of the ground
items.postText: Ahmar jami: "Bishoo has been given Super Duper Extra Large extended run at this level. He has not been very consistent and has been unable to justify his place. I think selectors did the right thing. They are now looking elsewhere."
items.shortText: Reifer to Mohammad Mithun, SIX runs

items.text: opens the face and steers the shortish ball outside off to point
items.shortText: Reifer to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: slower ball on off stump, defends
items.shortText: Reifer to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: shortish and outside off, steers it to deep third man
items.postText:
And please welcome Karthik back in the hot seat. 


AnamBMDF : "@Shanto: To me, this is the best team for BD in WC level, no doubt. It's because the experiences of Tamim, Shakib, Mushfiq, Mahmudullah and Mashrafi (5 *). They are role models for other young guns. We don't have a matchwinner singlehandedly in English condition. But, if Mashrafi is through the league, together ours can write a new chapter in the history. Let's support them within our limits. Rock on ...."

items.text: short, angling in towards off stump, doesn't really time this pull, sends it rolling along to the right of deep square leg
short again, outside off this time, pulled round to deep square leg

bowled him, Holder breaks the partnership. Lovely delivery, full but not a half-volley, and it nips in off the pitch to burst through the massive gap between bat and pad as Mithun looks for the big drive into the covers
items.postText:
Michael: "Brathwaite has no form to displace any of the quickies or batsmen picked so should not be in squad. Bravo has no form. Pollard and Russell would be a scary combination playing together as both showed ripping form in IPL. Pollard was also rotating strike and yesterday he chose to hit along the ground for fours with 3 on the long boundary behind the bowler. These would strengthen the squad immensely. Rutherford for Bravo." -- T20 form and ODI form are very different things, though. Two very different forms of the game, perhaps two different sports entirely.

Faruque: "Karthik @ Are you from Kolkata?" -- Nope, but I love the city.

Tasmeem: "Man, so many naysayers here. People tend to forget the gung ho approach like the English has its own demerit as well. When it doesn't come of, looks pretty ugly."

And that will be drinks. Mahmudullah walks in at No. 6.

items.text: back of a length close to off stump, stays leg-side of the ball  and jabs towards backward point
fullish outside off, presses forward and opens his bat face to get off the mark with a single to third man

items.preText: A gully in place for Mushfiqur
items.text: length ball outside off, good stride forward to block towards backward point
items.shortText: Holder to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run
